TopicTitle: Orion large ship random system freezes(good fps though...)

Articles.Content:
I'm still on my normal setup:

Fedora 24 x64

560 ti 1gb(GF114) 367.44 drivers

Phenom II 1100t

GA-970A-D3

8Gig(2x4gigs) 1600mhz DDR3?

Ship:(With modded parts needed to play. They are stock duplicates with weight name and thrust modifications.)

https://www.dropbox.com/s/4azi4dqnzmjg5lt/Orion1.1.3?dl=0

Player.log:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/mfd3vroaqk55sva/NewPlayer9_21_2.log?dl=0

 

It works really good on my computer. For 2300 max parts. It loads ok(Again, for a 2300 part ship). And once loaded it moves around really good(use low settings though.). It has fairly high FPS for 2300 parts and flies at a good speed that you would expect to get to orbit in a good amount of real time. Only problem is it is gauranteed to freeze my whole computer up at some random spot on the way to orbit. So I can't even manage to get it around Kerbin save and hope for another freeze not to happen or whatnot. not sure what to think of it but I;m so close to flying this thing it's not funny! I keep freezing around 6k or 15k or whatever it happens to freeze at. Not sure if there is a pattern yet.

This is the old orion but all the engines are one item each with values modified as if it were x amount of engines to reduce parts counts. No where near as laggy as normal. Just place ships in your save file and parts in the gamedata file. If desired there is a booster you can put in subassemblies for your save file but I'm not sure if it's the right one. I didn't check. But there is a ship with and without the correct boosters. So it's not important.

 

This ship should literally be in orbit and traveling around the solar system. But these system freezes keep stopping me.

 

Tip: if you fly it and it starts to move backwards just hold in the other direction and use RCS and SAS. It will be able to fix itself. But it likes to drift sometimes before like 300m/s. But it is correctable if you hold down the opposite direction until it corrects completely.

 

Edit: BTW, I'm not using mods per say. Just my modded parts in a normal install from that zip file. They are stock parts with a name, weight, thrust modded values. Nothing more. But I put it here just in case.

Shortucts:

Abort: Dump all ore

Break: Reverse all non engines/revert drill,thermalpanels,turn off everything but engines.

Lights: Toggle lights/Klaws

Gears: Extend/turn on Drills(non toggle)

0: Toggle Nuke engines

1: Toggle Rhino engines

2: Toggle Mammoth engines(non booster version)

3: Toggle Vector engines

4: Toggle Terrier engines

5: Toggle Poodle engines

6: Turn on ISRU Liquid fuel + open 1/4 thermal panels(If not liquid fuel one of the other 4 options)

7: Turn on ISRU Liquid fuel/Oxidizer + open 1/4 thermal panels(If not liquid fuel/Oxidizer one of the other 4 options)

8: Turn on ISRU Oxidizer + open 1/4 thermal panels(If not Oxidizer one of the other 4 options)

9: Turn on ISRU Mono + open 1/4 thermal panels(If not Mono one of the other 4 options)

 

For boostered version simply hit spacebar/stageing to activate boosters. No buttons required. For non boostered version turn on 1/2/3 and you will need fuel cheat.

Edit: I have been having problems with loading the game initially. I think this may have to do with my raid drive going to sleep randomly on me. I just moved all my games to it for space from my SSD. Could this be what is causing the random freezes? I'm currently moving my game back to my ssd to see if it helps alleviate the issue.

Edit2: Fresh install. Windows sizes all over the place before loading. And freezing without mods... This is some other game issue! 8\ it freezes my entire computer now every time I try to play. And it's a fresh install. I'm not putting up with any more of this.

Edited September 22, 2016 by Arugela
